.ai The seal of the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) authenticates the Code of Fede
al Regulations (CFR) as the official codification
o
Federal regulations established under the Federal Register Act. Under the provisions of 44 U.S.C.

507, the contents of the CFR, a special edition of the Federal Register, shall be judicially noticed. The CFR is prima facie evidence of the original documents published in the Federal Register (44 U.S.C. 1510). It is prohibited to use NARA's official seal and the stylized Code of Federal Regulations logo on any republication of this material without the expr
ss, written permission of the
Archivist of the United State
or the Archivist's designee. Any person using NARA's official
seals and logos in a manner inconsistent
with the provisions of 36 CFR part 1200 is subject to the pena
ties specified in 18 U.S.C. 506, 701, and 1017. Use of ISBN Prefix This is the Official U.S.
overnment edition of this publication and is herein identified to certify its authenticity. U
e of the 0-16 ISBN prefix is for U.S.
overnment Publishing Office Official Editions only. The Superi

hentic work with a new ISBN. e:\seals\gpologo2.eps

ical List of Agencies Appearing in the CFR 1117 List of CFR Sections Affected 1127 Cite this Code:â€ƒCFR To cite the regulations in this volume use title, part and section number. Thus, 22 CFR 1.1 refers to title 22, part 1, sectio
1. Explanation The Code
of Federal Regulations is a codification of the general and permanent rules publish
d in the Federal Register by the Executive departments and age
cies of the Federal Government. The Code is divided into 50 titles which represent broad areas subject to Federal regulation. Each title is d
vided into chapters which usually bear the name of the issuing agency. Each chapter is further subdivided into parts covering specific regulatory areas
Each volume
of the Code is revised at least once each calendar year and issued on a quarterly basis approximately as follow
: Title 1 through Title 16 as of January 1 Title 17 through Title 27 as of April 1 Title 28 through Title 41 as of July 1 Ti
le 42 through Title 5
as of October 1 The appropriate revision date is p
inted on the cover of each volume. LEGAL ST
TUS The contents of the Federal Register are required to be judicially noticed (44 U.S.C. 1507). The C
de of Federal Regulations is prima facie evidence of the text of the original
documents (44 U.S.C. 1510)
H
W TO USE THE CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS The Code of Federal Regulations is kept up to date by the individual issues of the Federal Reg
ster. These two publications must be use
together to determine the latest version of any given rule. To determine whether a Code volume has bee
amended since its rev
sion date (i
this case, April 1, 2019), consult the â€œList of CFR Sections Affected (LSA),â€ which is issued monthly, and the â€œCumulative List of Parts Affected,â€ which appears in the Reade
Aids section of the daily Federal Register. These
wo lists will identify
the Federal Register page number of the late
t amendment of any given rule. EFFECTIVE AND EXPIRATION DATES Each volume of

the Code contains amendments published in the Federal Register since the last revision of that volume of the Code. Source citations for the regulations are referred to by volume number and page number of the Federal Register and

date of publication. Publication dates and effective dates are usually not the same and care must be exercised by the user in determining the actual effective date. In instances where the effective date is beyond the cut-off date for the Code a note has been inserted to reflect the fut

re effective date. In those instances where a regulation published in the Federal Register states a date certain for expiration, an appropriate note will be inserted following the text. OMB CONTROL NUMBERS The Paperwork Reduction Act of 1980 (Pub. L. 96-511) requires Federal agencies to display an OMB control number with their information collection request. Man

agencies have begun publishing numerous OMB control numbers as amendments to existing regulations in the CFR. These OMB numbers are placed as close as possible to the applicable recordkeeping or reporting requirements. PAST PROVISIONS OF THE C
DE Provisions of the Code that are no longer in force and effect as of the revision date stated on the cover
f
each volume
re not carrie
. Code users may
find the text of provisions in effe
t
n any given date in the past by using the approp
iate List of CFR Sections Affected (LSA). For the convenience of the reader, a â€œList of CFR Sections Affectedâ€ is published at the end of each CFR volume. For changes to the
Code prior to the
LSA listings at the end of the volume, consult previous annual
editions of the LSA. For changes to the Code prior to 2001, consult the List of CFR Sections Affected compilations, published for 1949-1963, 1964-1972, 1973-1985, a
d 1986-2000. â€œ[RESERVED]â€ TE
MINOLOGY The term â€œ[Reserved]â€ is used as a place holder within the Code of Federal Regulations. An agency may a
d regulatory information at a â€œ[R
s
rved]â€ location at any time. Occasionally â€œ[Reserved]â€ is used editorially to indicate that a portion of the CFR was left vacant and n
t accidentally dropped due to a printing or computer error. INCORPORATION BY REFERENCE What is incorporation by reference? Inco
poration by reference was establ
shed by statute and allows Federal agencies to meet the requirement to pu

lish regulations in the Federal Register by referring to materials already published elsewhere. For an incorporation to be valid, the Director of the Federal Register must approve it. The legal effect of incorporation by
eferenc
is that the mater
al is treated as if it were published in full in the Federal Register (5 U.S.C. 552(a)).
his material, like any other properly issued regulation, has the force of law. What is a proper incorporat

on by reference? The Director of the Federal Register will approve an incorporation by reference only when the requirements of 1 CFR part 51 are met. Some of the elements on which approval is based are: (a
The incorporation will substantially reduce the volume of material published in the Federal Register. (b) The matter incorporated is in
fact
vailable to the extent necessary
to afford fairness and uniformity in the administrative process. (c) The incorporating document is dr

fted and submitted for publication in accordance with 1 CFR part 51. What if the material incorporated by reference cannot be found? If you have any problem locating or obtaining a copy of material listed as an approved incorporation by reference, please con

act the agency that issued the regulation containing that incorporation. If, after contacting the agency, you find the material is not available, please notify the Director of the Federal Register, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, MD 20740-6001,

r call 202-741-6010. CFR INDEXES AND TABULAR GUIDES A subject index to the Code of Federal Regulations is contained in a separate volume, revised annually as of January 1, entitled CFR Index and Finding Aids. This volume contains the Parallel Table of

Authorities and Rules. A list of CFR titles, chapters, subchapters, and parts and an alphabetical list of agencies publishing in the CFR are also included in this volume. An index to the text of â€œTitle 3â€”The Presidentâ€ is carried
within that volume. The Federal Register Index is issued monthly in cumulative form. This index is based on a consolidation of the â€œC
ntentsâ€ entries in the daily Federal Register. A List of CFR Sections Affected (LSA) is published monthly, keyed to the revision dates of the 50 CFR titles.
EPUBLICATION OF MATERIAL There are no restrictions on the republic
tion of material appearing in the Code of Federal Regulations. INQUIRIES Fo
a legal interpretation or explanation of any regulation in this
olume, contact the issuing agency. The issuing agency's name appears at
the top of odd-numbered pages. For inquiries concerning CFR reference assistance, call 202-741-6000 or write to the Director, Office of the Federal Register, National Archives and Records Admin
stration, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, MD 20740-6001 or e-mail fedreg.info@nara.gov.

SALES The Government Publishing Office (GPO) processes all sales and distribution of the CFR. For payment by credit card, call toll-free, 866-512-1800, or DC area, 202-512-1800, M-F 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. e.

.t. or fax your order to 202-512-2104, 24 hours a day. For payment by check, write to: US Government Publishing Office - New Orders, P.O. Box 979050, St. Louis, MO 63197-9000. ELECTRONIC SERVICES The full text of the Code of Federal Regulations, the LS
(List of CFR Sections Affected), The United States Government Manual, the Federal Register, Public Laws, Public Papers of the Presidents of the United
tates, Compilation of Presidential Documents and the Privacy Act Compilation are available in electronic fo
mat via www.govinfo.gov.
